G.T.5534
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 28th AUGUST, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
The 1st Army report the Canadians have captured PELVIES. The 4th Army have advanced their line astride the SOMME and have taken DENIEC0URT, ESTREES-DENIEC0URT, FAY, DOMPIERE, FRISE, CURLU, HARDECOURT. Otherwise no change is reported.
French Front.
The French have made considerable progress between NOYON and CHAULNES.
The line now runs PONT L'EVEQUE - CUY (probable) - DIEVES - LA POTIERE - AVRICOURT (exclusive) - MARGNY (inclusive)- SOLENTE - BIARRE - NESLE - MESNIL - POTTE - LICOURT.
Reports state the French have also reached the SOMME between EPENANCOURT and BETHENCOURT.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
No change.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
28th August, 1918.
Issued at 6.40 p.m.
